text:
Howdy dev community!

We just finished a slick new version of the blog importer, and we thought we would try and get it in the hands of those who use it most (you all!).

Notably, it imports Wordpress featured images :man_dancing:, and also has an option to strip out Wordpress shortcodes that were left in the XML export. 

Anyone interested in trying it out?
<@U24GZQ3GF>
<@U7TAZ6V2Q>
I want to give it a go

If I opt out of all emails on the email preferences page, it says I am opted out of all emails. If I fill out a form and check the boxes for marketing information and the blog emails, it still says I am opted out of all emails. Not sure if that is intended.
Likewsie, would love to try
Yeah I think we'll have a use for that soon
Also, after checking the two boxes, when I go to the preferences/subscription page, it says I’m opted out of all emails. Again, I’m not sure if that is the intended behavior.
I've encountered this as well.  It seems that the only way to opt back in is through a subscription preferences page.
DM me your portal IDs please!
Is there anywhere that lists out the differences in what you can do with Workflows in both marketing workflows and sales workflows?
Like in sales workflows, you cant use lists (if you just have sales without the marketing plans)
Is there a way to include a global group inside of a custom module?

haven’t tried it but there is a hubl tag for global groups I think, you could try placing that inside the module.

If you can’t find the hubl tag for global groups in the documentation, using the new design manager you should be able to view the coded version of a drag n drop template and that should reveal that hubl code
it’s giving me a “include is disabled for this context” error so I’m guessing it isn’t going to happen.
danm
I’m going to have to do some js butchery
if it’s gotta use hubl include, then yea it’s not gonna work
Every time we use fullpage.js we are so excited at the beginning…
Then the horrible reality sets in.

I have just found that even with the cookies declined  (__hs_opt_out = yes). I still having some HS cookies in Wordpress. I have been investigating and think it's because some CTAs&forms we are loading by JS calls... anyone else have found a similar issue? any solution for this?
Is there a default location, or method for setting up a "Withdrawal of consent (or opt out)" section for GDPR? I see references to the HubSpot API calls, but nothing about getting this configured
maybe <@U24DCSJBE>?
Aside from turning off the grammerly plugin, is there a way to keep it from injecting code into the text in HubSpot?

Here's a weird thing:
I have this image <https://cdn2.HubSpot.net/hub/78380/hubfs/iCIMS%20Logo%20Bottom%20Tagline%20-%20Transparent%20Background.png>
If I resize it past a certain point, it turns into a black rectangle <https://cdn2.HubSpot.net/hub/78380/hubfs/iCIMS%20Logo%20Bottom%20Tagline%20-%20Transparent%20Background.png?width=300>
The smallest possible size seems to be 601. I can presumably upload a smaller original image, but the resize function is oh-so-handy.

is there a way to turn off these walk throughs in accounts? If I do one walkthrough in a company's portal, it shouldn't ask me to do it in future portals. Is that possible or is there some secret way to do this?
is the new HubSpot Site search module available in all templates? I have an account that I'm working on that doesn't seem to have it
Does this have to be ungated?
Yea i think its still in beta stage <@U6GNQ7JBU> would know more
You should have it if you have the new IDE
yeah <@U6GNQ7JBU> I have the new IDE - but it wasn't in there
Which portal? The design manager team was changing how these modules are delivered
<@U6GNQ7JBU> here is the HubID: 4536304
<@U6GNQ7JBU> I was able to get the module however now I am getting a module disconnected error:
